A regatta is a series of boat races. The term comes from the Venetian language regata meaning "contest" and typically describes racing events of rowed or sailed water craft, although some powerboat race series are also called regattas.
A fleet race is a race in which all competitors start simultaneously.
A sailboat is a boat propelled partly or entirely by sails.

Sailing is the art of controlling a sailing vessel.

The America's Cup, affectionately known as the "Auld Mug", is a trophy awarded to the winner of the America's Cup match races between two sailing yachts.
